message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.CR, cs.DB 

Reasoning: 
- cs.CL (Computation and Language): The paper focuses on using natural language processing (NLP) techniques to identify financial institutions from transaction descriptions, which falls under the scope of this sub-category. 
- cs.IR (Information Retrieval): The paper deals with retrieving information about financial institutions from transaction descriptions, which is a core topic in information retrieval. 
- cs.LG (Machine Learning): The paper uses supervised learning methods to infer the identity of the sending FI, which falls under the scope of this sub-category. 
- cs.CR (Cryptography and Security): The paper may be relevant to this sub-category as it deals with financial transactions and the identification of financial institutions, which may have security implications. 
- cs.DB (Databases): The paper deals with managing and analyzing large datasets of financial transactions, which falls under the scope of this sub-category.
